alert.note: Alert for Clay; Jackson; Laurel (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 3:01PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Laurel, south central Jackson and Clay Counties through 330 PM EDT... At 301 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Portersburg, or 8 miles east of London, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Urban, Grace and Bush around 305 PM EDT. Sidell, Hooker, Herron, Sibert, Fall Rock, Pigeonroost, Treadway, Burning Springs, Jonsee and Cottongin around 310 PM EDT. Manchester, Littleton, Horse Creek Junction, Bernice, Hima, Bluehole, Mill Pond, Laurel Creek, House and Park Valley around 315 PM EDT. Hector, Boho, Tanksley, Wild Cat, Goose Rock, Hensley, Botto, Seth and Lipps around 320 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Peabody, Enline, Spurlock, Barcreek and Plank. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
